title: Abbey Lincoln - You Gotta Pay The Band (1991) RESEED
description:
MP3/192kbps

This set features Stan Getz, who provides a wonderful foil for Lincoln&#039;s voice. Sadly, Getz died a few months after these sessions, the only collaboration between the two. Lincoln&#039;s own songs represent the majority of material on the album; standouts include "Bird Alone" and "When I&#039;m Called Home." A deep sense of spirituality empowers much of this work, one the arises from the way in which Lincoln melds the emotional bearing of blues with the more cerebral forays of jazz. She&#039;s backed by a superlative trio of Hank Jones on piano, Charlie Haden on bass, and Mark Johnson on drums. This is an essential title for anyone interested in either Abbey Lincoln or Stan Getz.

Personnel
Abbey Lincoln :Vocal
Stan Getz :Tenor Saxophone
Hank Jones :Piano
Charlie Haden :Bass
Mark Johnson :Drums
Maxine Roach (1, 10) :Viola

Song List:
1.Bird Alone - 08:33
2.I&#039;m In Love - 06:11
3.You Gotta Pay The Band - 04:47
4.Brother, Can You Spare A Dime? - 06:45
5.You Made Me Funny - 03:00
6.And How I Hoped For Your Love - 03:35
7.When I&#039;m Called Home - 05:24
8.Summer Wishes, Winter Dreams - 06:26
9. Up Jumped Spring [lyric version] - 04:35
10.A Time For Love - 08:40
